Data Replay Loop

Data Replay Loop contains any data replay components, within this replay loop, in the referenced FPGA. Data replay loops define a loop rate for all contained FPGA data replays.

What do you want to do?

Change Data Update Rate

To change the data update rate for all contained data replays, change the value in the control Loop Rate found on the page below. Be sure not to exceed the update rate capability of your hardware I/O. Note the requested loop rate and the actual loop rate may mismatch slightly due to the FPGA conversion process.

Add data replay(s)

To add data replay(s), click the Add Data Replay(s) button. You also can right-click Data Replays in the configuration tree and select Add Data Replay(s) from the shortcut menu.

Remove data replay(s)

To remove a single data replay, select the data replay name in the configuration tree and select the red X button.

To remove multiple data replays, select the Remove Data Replay(s) button. You also can right-click Data Replays in the configuration tree and select Remove Data Replay(s) from the shortcut menu.

View or change a data replay

To view or change a data replay, select the data replay item in the configuration tree. The Data Replay Configuration page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

For more information about adding and configuring custom devices, refer to the Configuring and Running a Project book of the NI VeriStand Help, available by selecting Help»Search the NI VeriStand Help.
